Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Martin W
Reviews.Content: For the price this hotel is not worth looking at. Good location but then it went downhill all the way....characterless hotel rooms are miniscule, bathroom required a sit down shower position and no provision for toilet paper or then I am not used to French customs , never seen that ... I didn't even bother with breakfast and got something at the station.... the Mercure at the station is much better value for money. Some might be put off by the presence of a large sex shop next door...not your usual neighbour to a Holiday Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious room and comfy bed!”
Reviews.Author: JoNunis
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights and we flew in from Madrid. Took a cab instead of the train as we had 3 heavy luggages! Taxi fare was €67 as we got stuck in heavy traffic. The Gare de Lyon train station is just down the street from the hotel and its so convenient to move around with it. But being first timer at the station, we were so confused with the lines and didn't know where to take the train as the station was huge! There is also another station called Gare de Australitz which is just behind the hotel and have to cross a bridge to get there. The hotel room is great! We had the room with balcony and was facing the street. Not too noisy at night. What I love about Holiday Inns are the pillows...they have soft or firm pillows upon your request. We did have slight problem getting though the receptionist via our room phone through out our stay, it was always on engage tone! One night, our TV was not working and my hubby had to call housekeeping and got them to get the reception to call us back. We didn't try the buffet breakfast and ate at the cafe nearby the station. The cafes have breakfast set menu as low as €5. On our last night, we decided to try La'Europian restaurant just beside the train station and it was worth it. Dinner set menu for €33 was affordable as it came with wine,coffee,starter,main & dessert! Overall, the hotel has good service, staff was attentive to your request and friendly too. Room has the warm feeling and clean. And the location is good for people who depend on public transport in Paris. Oh yes, there is also a Carrefour nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay!”
Reviews.Author: alexandra1721
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved the ten days I spent at this hotel! The rooms were clean, comfortable, quiet, and attractive, and the hotel itself was absolutely beautiful. The concierge went above and beyond to make our stay memorable and the buffet breakfast was unbelievable. I don't think I could've found another restaurant that offered a breakfast quite as good as that one was. If ever I am lucky enough to see Paris again in this lifetime, I will without a doubt be staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Hapiness168
Reviews.Content: Coming from Bern, Switzerland via TGV Lyria, last stop Gare de Lyon, decided to stay in this hotel and we were not disappointed. The hotel is just 2-3 minutes walk from the station. Check-in was quick and front desk staff was very friendly and helpful. With high ceiling and adequately lighted, the hotel looks grand. We were given a room with a balcony facing the street. At first, we were apprehensive of the noise coming from outside but we didn't hear any. Our room looks like it had just been renovated and I just loved the glass panels between our room and the bathroom. Some rooms in our floor are under renovation but we didn't hear any noise. Breakfast was adequate but expensive. Since it is located very near Gare de Lyon, going around Paris is very easy with the Metro and RER and inexpensive. Lots of cafes and restaurants near the hotel. We asked for a taxi to bring us to the airport but were surprised that they called a private car transfer. Had to pay extra. Definitely would come back.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, Friendly staff and Location 'parfait'”
Reviews.Author: JackUk01
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 days in this Hotel and loved it. Excellent facilitiies, the rooms look sparkling new and modern. Good furniishing. The best thing is the location. The Railway station is a 2 mins by walk and there are loads of cafes around. Would definitely recommend both for business and pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Very Satisfactory”
Reviews.Author: Ellie J
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel clean and comfortable. I wouldn't say that it was anything special and was missing an element of luxury but it was friendly and had everything I needed for my one night stay on a work trip. I was working for the most part but the hotel did seem well located and near to tourist attractions. I slept very soundly.

Reviews.Title: “Good!”
Reviews.Author: teudatole
Reviews.Content: Very good expirience. Rooms are very clean and nice looking. There is a hair dryer, minibar and tv. TV has only CNN in english, but i didnt come to paris to warch it. WIFI is slow and awkward couse you need to reconnect every hour... But it's free. No electricity socket near the bed. No kettle in room. Breakfast each day from 06:45 to 10... And weekend untill 11. Bacon, sausages, eggs, beans and unavoidable bagets and cruasons - very good. Location is nice too. Very nice smelling soap. Toilet and bathroom are separated, not sure if it is good or bad lol. In lobby there are two computers with intetnet and printers for those who want to check in online on flight. Very polite and friendly staff. Overall - i recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I liked it, my friend didn't”
Reviews.Author: ddd007
Reviews.Content: My travelling mate and I differed about this hotel. I liked it very much, thought it was convenient for sightseeing, excellent service, very clean, decent breakfast, just down the road from a good supermarket. He didn't like the area (near a major railway station and with some homeless people on the streets) and next door to a sex shop. The remote on our TV didn't work (the TV did) and the bathroom door didn't close properly. He hasn't had much experience of Paris hotels and, I think, these were minor concerns. My one disappointment was that the free broadband was slow. Fine for emails but not for uploading photos.

Reviews.Title: “Watch your stuff”
Reviews.Author: RolandGarrosBound
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in this hotel 2 years in a row. The first year (2010) everything seemed fine, regular run of the mill holiday inn. We chose it again in 2011 because we knew the metro from here, the location etc. This stay however was very different. The internet (wireless) will cost you an arm and a leg (60 Euro for 5 days) and it had speed slower than dial up from the 90's. Not what you would expect at that price. Every time we came back to the hotel after it had been cleaned we were missing things. A coat and a pair of pants that belonged to my 1 year old son. We searched every nook and cranny of the room. As well a pair of prescription eyeglasses of mine. When we went to check out we were in a huge rush to catch a flight to Germany but spoke to the manager. She would "email us" asap as she would look/ask around. We came back through Paris a week later and decided to stop by. When we came back to ask about the items we were blown off and treated as if we were from another planet. Not exactly what you would expect from a world wide chain hotel. For the price.... stay else where, do your research. You can find much nicer hotels with all the same amenities plus more for much less! We will NEVER return to a Holiday Inn again

Reviews.Title: “a nice place”
Reviews.Author: gjergjii
Reviews.Content: Everything OK ... Do not ask at the reception to show you places on the map. i asked about Orsay museum and they marked on my map a point next to tower Eiffel. I lost one hour just because of the wrong orientation. the rest was nice, clean and comfortable. location was good and breakfast excellent

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, good location, new rooms”
Reviews.Author: Hagai9
Reviews.Content: looks like it was renovated lately. the hotel looks nice, the room is very comfortable and new. great breakfast. good location.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Lily K
Reviews.Content: Arriving in Paris, we were very excited. The Holiday Inn is positioned very well and close to all amenities. The room, although very small, however was new and had a romantic feel. The bathroom was impressive. It was disappointing that there was no breakfast included in the price and staff were a little abrupt. Down the road is the bus stop for the hop on, hop off tour bus which was great and value for money, especially if your in Paris for a short time and want to check out all the main attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fussy_Irish_mom
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights and had a lovely stay. The hotel was really easy to find by taking the train to the Gare de Lyon, which was a very handy base and less than 5 mins walk from the hotel. I picked the hotel based on the reviews here and as mentioned in other reviews there is a sex shop adjacent the hotel. To be honest the neon light made it easy to find the hotel and the shop itself made no impact on our stay. I think I only once saw someone coming out of it! The area itself had a few homeless people in the vicinity and on our first night there was a feed run. But again they didn't interfere with us. THe hotel itself was lovely. The room was a decent size for Paris and the bed was large and very comfortable. THe room was quiet and clean and warm. The bathroom had a shower and bath and was great. I do love a decent hot shower! Actually they had a nice note that if you'd forgotten anything like deodarant or toothpaste they would supply it on a complimentary basis. There was a nice bar near reception which was great for a drink or two before or after dinner and they bar tender was really nice. We didn't have breakfast in the hotel because it was too expensive and there was a nice cafe serving petit dejuner across the road. The hotel was also within walking distance of Gare d'Austerlitz where we caught the train to Versailles. And it was near enough to the Seine that we had a beautiful walk on the river bank to Notre Dame. The team at reception were also really helpful any time we needed anything. Overall, we really enjoyed our stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “solid hotel”
Reviews.Author: Imbach77
Reviews.Content: hotel is only 3 min to Gare de Lyon where several major lines can be raken to either City center or Disneyland. service is ok but not great. Rgular price is usually too high for what you get nwvertheless a solid hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great location, the hotel is in very good condition”
Reviews.Author: SvenZH
Reviews.Content: This hotel is actually closer from the gare du Nord as from the Bastille Square. It makes it very easy to travel in paris the subway is very close and with the RERyou re 2 stop from les Halles and 3 stoops from the champs elysee. The rooms are comfortable and the outlook is quite new. The wifi is free in the Rooms as well. the breakfast spread is good and nothing is missing . It is really a good hotel for the value and the staff is friendly

Reviews.Title: “Very good for nice Paris vacation”
Reviews.Author: Koshka M
Reviews.Content: Newly renovated, comfortable and of good taste. Small rooms - but no other rooms in Paris. Absolutely clean. I'm totally psych about cleaning - but it WAS clean. Well equipped bathroom, towels were changed every day. Comfortable bed, new linens, but I would prefer much more stiff matress. Total soundproof. Mini-frizer, TV, free WiFi. A lot of storage room. Tasty fresh breakfast - could survive on it half day easily! Big breakfast area. Friendly Englishspeaking staff. Few min from Gare de Lyon, one of the central metro stations, with good connection to RER and city lines. Cafe and restorants near by, and MONOP's shop with all basic foods and reasonable prices. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A very good choice”
Reviews.Author: Fred63
Reviews.Content: We were glad that we chose to stay at this hotel for our visit to Paris. The King size bed was very comfortable. There was no noise at night and we slept soundly. The breakfast was more than adequate. We asked for an iron and got one within 10 minutes. The hotel is in a very good location. Wewent for a walk in the Bastille area and came across a lovely square - the Place des Voges. There were 2 museums nearby andboth were free - the Maison de Victor Hugo and the Musee de L'Histoire de Paris. We also walked across the Seine to the Jardin des Plantes - a better park than the Jardin du Luxembourg. The hotel is close to the Gare de Lyons which is on the Metro line 1 which passes many of the top site, such as the Louvre, Champs Elysee and Arc de Triomphe. It also has the RER line to the Disney parks and has connectionsto CDG airport. Two visits we would recommend are to the Rodin museum and a night cruise from Pont Neuf - the buildings are particularly impressive lit up at night.

Reviews.Title: “You can do so much better in Paris”
Reviews.Author: eatandrun33
Reviews.Content: Had this hotel booked for 5 nights but ended up leaving after 2. Booked a Deluxe room and I'm still not sure what made it Deluxe as opposed to Standard apart from a price difference. The room was nicely appointed, not very large. Clean, nice linen, desk, TV, bathroom, window - very basic. The bathroom door which is directly off the small room is paper thin...terrible, if, like me you can suffer bathroom "stage freight". The "free mini-bar" consisted of 1 x small bottle of water, 1 x small pelegrino, 1 x small bottle of O.J - That's it! I really don't know how they justify calling this a mini-bar. Internet access was gained after credit card payment.....(remember, this is suppossed to be a deluxe room!) The room itself was quite dark although the bedsheets were white and clean, the bed was comfortable with a different selection on pillows upon request. There was also suppossed to be bathrobes and slippers in the room which we were informed are really only provided upon request. The location was good only if you need a train from gare de lyon and are staying overnight. We were informed we would have breakfast available in the hotel and then upon confirmation explained that breakfast was not included in the deluxe room rate. The staff were pleasant enough and professional but upon waking on the third morning after a big night out, needing to get prepared for an important meeting, we rudely discovered that there was no hot water........no explaination given or information as to when it would be turned on again.....Needless to say the only business meeting I had while holidaying in Paris had to be rescheduled while we checked out and found another hotel which could provide a warm shower.....best thing we ever did. Seriously, there are better places to stay than this and it's completely overpriced compared to the many more beautiful hotels available.

Reviews.Title: “Very good for a Eurodisney break with children....”
Reviews.Author: kcbf
Reviews.Content: Great hotel if you want to take children to Eurodisney, but want to stay in Paris rather than at one of the hotels at the Eurodisney park. The 'family' rooms are very large for Paris and have everything you need. More importantly and specifically with respect to small children - they don't have anything that is easy to break, pull down, dismantle, etc. Normally I have to do a once-over in hotel rooms and move items to high places, re-arrange furniture, etc. but this is spartan enough that it wasn't necessary. Also, the price was very good. Only downside was the breakfast was definitely not up to scratch - especially for the price. However, with small children, going out for breakfast wasn't really an option so we were stuck.

Reviews.Title: “A wekend in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Ferdinand1
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel to stay for Paris discovering.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, annoying hotel”
Reviews.Author: TumblinSun
Reviews.Content: This Holiday Inn is beautiful outside, spare and modern inside. Located close to the Gare de Lyon Train Station and Metro stop for getting around Paris, it is also near many restaurants and stores for food and personal items. It is just a block off of the Seine so it's easy to find, and is near a Seine River Poster & photo exhibit area, which was nice to walk by. It was also close to the new Opera House & the Bastille, a good area for shops and restaurants, and another Metro Stop plus many bus routes connect here. I read another review that conflicts with our experience. Our biggest complaint was lack of an iron in our room. Paris is a fashionable city so we brought nice clothes that were rumpled when we arrived. The hotel only had a few to lend out to guests, and we and other guests had to wait several days to get one as the staff was disinclined to get them back from other guests. While we did have an in-room safe, hair-dryer, fridge, TV, shampoo & lotion; we did not have face cloths, conditioner, ironing board, snacks or drinks, or a coffee maker. We didn't get robes or slippers other reviewers mentioned. The staff was also polite, but not helpful. They do not help you with directions or information on places you might want to visit, although they will give you a map. When they called a taxi to take us to the airport, we were asked to go back inside to wait, as they didn't another taxi stopping for us. But when they told me this, they didn't offer to help me back in with my three rolling bags. So the hotel is clean and convenient, but not especially friendly or helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: RuthMJ
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in July the weekend after Bastille Day with my husband and youngest daughter. We were initially put in a room for two people and had to request a change to the three bedroom room we had booked and paid for before arrival. We then had to put in a special request for bedding for the pull out bed. The reception staff weren't particularly friendly or helpful though that may have been due to the fact that the woman who sorted out our room change was at the front desk at 6.00pm and still there at 9.00am the next morning. Some of the local restaurants and shops appeared to be closed due to the Bastille Day weekend holiday. The hotel room itself was very clean and comfortable though our room was very hot and we only figured out how to lower the air conditioning on the last day. I didn't feel like asking the reception staff about the air conditioning as I felt slightly intimidated by them and my French is abysmal. The breakfast was great, hot food, cereal, tasty breads and cheese and the breakfast staff seemed quite friendly and helpful. When we'd booked the hotel directly online through the Holiday Inn website it had stated that there was a maximum of 2 breakfasts available per room but there was no problem (and no extra cost) with the third person breakfast. The location is good - the Gare d'Austerlitz is just across the river if you want to catch the direct Metro to the Eiffel Tower and off course the Gare de Lyon is a few minutes walk away. The hotel is just outside the main tourist area which is reflected in the price as it seemed slightly cheaper than other Paris Holiday Inns. There's a Monoprix mini-mart for stocking up on snacks just across the road on the Rue de Lyon and a few hundred yards along the Rue on the same side of the road as the hotel is a Carrefour supermarket. No hassle from the sex shop next door in fact the neon shop sign is quite useful for helping with your bearings when you get off the train at the Gare de Lyon on arrival. Some good restaurants nearby, especially at the corner of the Rue de Lyon and Boulevard Diderot. To sum up, good for comfort, location and value, but possibly requiring some staff customer service skill training.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Good Location, Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Agitater
Reviews.Content: Paris is expensive not doubt, but this Holiday Inn has higher than averages room rates for a hotel of this kind in Paris. Pay-per-use Internet or pay-per-use time blocks are a holdover from the 1990s and early 2000s - time for free hotel wireless everywhere please. Internet connection speeds even for the premier pay plan are not good. The breakfast restaurant is quite good - fresh, healthy and lots of variety and the coffee is excellent. The rooms are very quiet (Rue de Lyon is quite peaceful at night). My room was actually larger than average for Paris I think, and the bathroom was recently upgraded. Lots of small amenities including bathrobe and slippers (you can take the slippers with you when you check out), iron, pants press, ironing board, safe, small fridge, hair dryer, lots of extra towels and extra pillows. The location is excellent, 5 minute walk to the canal and the Seine, 20 minute walk to Ile de la Cite, 10 minute walk to Bastille, 5 minute walk to Gare de Lyon (and all the TGV trains, half a dozen Metro lines, regional trains), dozens of good restaurants of all descriptions (French, regional, Italian, Japanese, Chinese, Mediterranean, American and so on. No real complaints about the hotel at all - comfortable and accessible and very well located (Le Marais is only a 25 minute walk). In my opinion though, it's just too expensive for what it is - an upscale Holiday Inn with aspirations to bigger things. Lots of business travelers in the Holiday Inn Paris Bastille - it's not a family-oriented hotel - because it has a lot of business amenities (meeting rooms, projectors, sound systems, various size conference and exhibition areas, etc.). Although it is possible to hear street noise at night (the usual sounds of a dark city - sirens, the occasional loud car, the occasional drunk), choose a room facing Rue de Lyon for its sunrise and sunset views of old Paris rooftops. Still, with free Internet, it would be a much better value.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, cute room!”
Reviews.Author: jtsai720
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Holiday Inn for 2 nights from 8/24-8/26. It's in a great location, right near Gare du Lyon, which has a lot of subway lines. It's a 20 min. walk to the Notre Dame, and 10 min. walk to Bastille. It's a pretty quiet neighborhood with a few restaurants and cute bakeries. It has a supermarket a few minutes away as well. The room we stayed in was on the small side, but comfortable and clean. We had 2 single beds that were pushed very close together. The only problem was that there is no clock in the room! A huge pro is that there is free Internet in the lobby. There are 2 computers and a printer for your use that no one was ever using. There's wifi in the lobby as well. Con: you have to pay for local calls (found this to be true for other hotels in France as well though) Overall, great hotel. Would definitely stay at it again!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel ... a bit expensive though!”
Reviews.Author: se7s
Reviews.Content: +ve: - 3 minutes walking distance from Gare De Lyon – a main station (metro and train). - Clean and elegant room. - Spacious breakfast restaurant, with nice view on the street - Free Internet Wifi - Carrefour Market is just 5 minutes walk from the hotel, so you can buy water, snacks, bread, salads, etc … at reasonable prices. - A nice neighborhood. -ve: - expansive for a 3 stars hotel, yet the property quality is good. - breakfast choices are limited. - Although the hotel is well located very closely to a main station, it's quite far from all attractions. It requires a fit person to walk to the closest attraction which is Notre Dame. Nevertheless, Paris has a strong transportation network that facilities the move a lot, specially that the hotel is well located next to a metro and train station. - A sex shop is just on the door step of the hotel, which might attract ppl you don't want to encounter, although I personally didn't see anyone going in or out of it. PS. DON'T buy the tickets of the Open Tour ... It looks attractive that you can roam the whole city, hopping on and off (especially that it passes right infornt of the hotel) .... But in practicality, it's a terrible time waster ... It took me more than 4 hours to go from Arc De Triumph to the hotel, for a journey that takes 20 minutes by metro! ... Plus, the last bus on the Open Tour is at 7 pm. Not recommended at all! My overall experience in the hotel is positive, and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for the money”
Reviews.Author: HL24
Reviews.Content: Great for Paris on a budget but yet you don't want to stay in a typical budget hotel. This was 2 blocks from a huge metro stop, that also rented cars. 2 minute walk from the bus stop that serviced general and tour buses. The breakfast was excellent. The only need for improvement area was: 1- Internet would time out after an hour and you would have to fill out a profile each time. 2- the people that worked the front desk during the day was great and very knowledgable, the people at night .. Not at all...so get any information you need during the day.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay, good location”
Reviews.Author: AMPBucks
Reviews.Content: Service - check in was speedy and efficient, not particularly warm, but helpful on the one or two occasions when we needed help. Room - was very nice, extremely comfortable and nicely equipped. Good place to sleep and relax. Bathroom was also nicely equipped - I do like the curved shower curtain rail which leaves you more room in the shower space. Location and amenities - good location for finding small restaurants locally to eat. Great for getting about Paris on the metro - well-positioned. Liked best and least - Service was a bit corporate, not very warm, but it was efficient and there were no surprises!

Reviews.Title: “Good size room, odd fittings in great location”
Reviews.Author: RoamingHorse
Reviews.Content: My family & I stayed for 3 nights and found this Hotel well located, a short taxi ride from Gare Du Nord station which we got off the Euro Star from London. Taxi queue was long but fairly quickly taken due to abundant arrival of taxis. With 3 fairly large luggage, we did not risk saving on the fare with the need to lug them over stair-cases if we took the RER. Check in was quick and lady receptionist was efficient who could be more friendly & welcoming. Hotel is well located near Gare De Lyon station for easier access by bus, metro & RER less than 5 minutes walk away. I have attached a picture listing the various options (Bus #20, 24, 63. 65, 87 & Bb / RER= A & D/ & Metro= Line 14) if you use Gare De Lyon station for your travelling needs in Paris. Our King Executive King room was large enough with a comfortable extra bed. Room was dusty. Has very quiet air-conditioning by far but the odd thing about the room is the lack of any towel racks or sufficient free space to place your toiletries bags, change of clothing or used towels. Tea making facility does not have any plain tea bags but they do offer a selection of flavored tea & coffee but no milk or creamer. Aside for this lack of user friendly oddity, the facilities, service & location was good. We would return to stay in this Hotel if we return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a fairly central location.”
Reviews.Author: Phynn
Reviews.Content: Spent a week in this hotel and, apart from one waiter, the staff were excellent. Our room was excellent. We must have been lucky as our toilets were not cramped like others that have commented. Shame they don't do evening meals in the restaurant (room service only) but there are plenty of excellent restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but...”
Reviews.Author: Mikengo
Reviews.Content: All the reviews says it all. Few comments though. The front desk agents need to wear a smile on their face (one customer was kind enough to cheer them up). First impression was not welcoming at all. Eye contact with customers are not there everytime when we approach lobby. There's this "Don't bug me" look puts us away from asking informations, promotions, directions, etc and that pulls down my ratings by 2 stars. Sorry but I compare this to the other hotel I stayed earlier in Paris and the staff gave me the warmth. Overall, good hotel, staff is somewhat helpful but not friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Good overnight for Gare de Lyon”
Reviews.Author: HKTraveler1234
Reviews.Content: After a long flight, we arrived in the morning and needed a place for an overnight stay before our departure to south of France the next morning from Gare de Lyon. Looked at Novotel and some other options and decided to stay here based on TA's reviews. Since we were arriving early in the morning, we also paid for the night before so that we can check in early and have one of the rooms for our baby to sleep in. Reservation: reserved on the website and decided to choose the advance purchase rate. At E160 per night (without breakfast), this seems to be cheaper than other options in town since we were here in July during tourist season. I also emailed the hotel ahead of time to inform them that we will be checking in early in the morning so that they will keep the room for us and also put in a baby cot. Received a prompt and courteous reply and everything was set when we check in. One odd thing is the reservation system didn't allow the four of us (2 adults, 1 child and 1 baby who sleeps in baby cot) to all stay in the same room and we wind up taking 2 rooms. Had we known the size of the rooms, we probably could have saved some money and all cramped into one room. Location: our train departs the next morning from Gare de Lyon. Given jet lag, lots of luggages and two child, we didn't feel like taking a taxi or the subway to reach the train station. This is a very good location to the station and is an easy 3 minutes walk even with luggage. You can see the Gare de Lyon in the background in one of the photos. Across the street, there is a good bakery where we bought our breakfast and lunch sandwich. The almond croissant was excellent! The sex shop next door was not that noticeable and did not present a problem even though we were traveling with two young children. I am not even sure if my wife even noticed it. The neighborhood seems to be mostly restaurants and bakeries. Check-in: was efficient and quick. There was no line and they gave us the pre-assigned room quickly. We did have two very heavy luggages and they didn't offer to help though given that this is a Holiday Inn, I wasn't expecting it anyway. Room: decently furnished with all the basic amenities one would look for. On my previous trips to Paris, I have come to expect tiny rooms and this one was decent size given my expectations. We managed to have two luggages on the floor and a baby cot. We would have been able to cramp into the same room had we known the size. In no way is this large but it was decent for an over-night stay. We were one floor above the reception facing the streets and it does get a little noisy especially when a car or motorcycle speed down the road. I did find that once I tried to close the window very tightly, the noise doesn't come through as much and is tolerable. In the other room, the window handle can't be turned as much and it was a bit of a nuisance. Summary: conveniently located for Gare de Lyon, reasonably priced, no real problems aside from a bit of noise from the streets. Would come back if I need to overnight near the Gare de Lyon.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: oompahdave
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights and were very pleased with this quality hotel. A very good neighborhood, with lots of interesting things within walking distance. Don't miss the nearby gardens. The Gare du Lyon train station and metro are just two blocks away and it's a short walk to the hop on-hop off boat, which is a great way to see the city. Many restaurants in the area. We skipped the somewhat pricey breakfast buffet in favor of nearby cafes. Modern, well appointed rooms. Free Internet. Very reasonably priced for Paris. We would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, great value!”
Reviews.Author: DissapointedUsa
Reviews.Content: This hotel y located a block away from Gare de Lyon and the metro station. Lots of restaurants, coffee shops, Mom&Pop stores, ATMs a convenient store and a Carrefour close by. The room was clean and not too tight, bathroom nice and internet access excellent and free. Breakfast buffet was $16 euros/person, worth taking for something different but a bit on the expensive side. Some of the front-desk people were very knowledgeable and ready to help, some not, but in most cases they didn't speak much English so communications were a bit difficult at times. Other than that, excellent place!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, modern, with a touch of historical elegance”
Reviews.Author: SeaBreeze77
Reviews.Content: The recent remodel here was very well done---well appointed hotel, with an excellent territorial view of Paris. The neighborhood could be considered a drawback for some, as it is "up and coming", "in transition", etc....whatever descriptives you wish to fill in. On the bright side, prices at restaurants (though still high by most standards) are a touch cheaper in this neighborhood than many others in Paris and there's an excellent grocery store (called Monoprix) across the street that has excellent prices. The room itself is extremely spacious by Paris standards, with comfortable beds, televison, and a very large bathroom with a tub/shower combination. We had a room facing the main road, and it was somewhat noisy at night but nothing that kept us (light sleepers) from sleeping soundly. If you are especially light sleepers, you may wish to book an inside room. The staff was excellent, friendly and helpful without being obtrustive to your stay. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Leandro_Rey
Reviews.Content: First room was not so good. We changed of room on the second day without problem. Staff is very helpful. Good price (breakfast included) if reserved in advance. Excellent localization, near Gare de Lyon (Metro + Train).

Reviews.Title: “OK - wouldn't hurry back.”
Reviews.Author: Mumdad2boys
Reviews.Content: A rather expensive overnight stay in Paris. A suite on the top floor with no view was not what we expected. One window blocked, the other could see no monuments, even when hanging out as far as possible. Clean and spacious, but no proper shower, only an over bath shower beneath a sloping roof. It would have been impossible to shower standing up. Floor lit by movement sensors which didn't work properly, leaving us in darkness to find the door and insert our key. Beautiful historic building from the outside, which doesn't transfer inside beyond the reception area. Stay with Holiday Inn lots, this was a disappointment. Bizarre tiny pillows which feel like you can't move or you will roll off them.

Reviews.Title: “Worth it.”
Reviews.Author: FromPhillyPa
Reviews.Content: This little hotel was a nice surprise. Close to metros, cages, banks, and a nice grocery. Staff was friendly, helpful and knowledgeable. Rooms facing the main street were a bit noisy but, I would stay there again in a minute.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location. Nice facility.”
Reviews.Author: TSAFun
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nicely appointed and had tasteful modern furnishings. Located very near to train station & metro. Folks say that the bathrooms are small, but we thought that they were a decent size~ given that this was Paris. There was a safe and fridge in the room. Elevators were great. Plenty of restaurants nearby. Staff were friendly and helpful. Great value for the money. We'd go back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location good rooms”
Reviews.Author: ashuc
Reviews.Content: We chose the hotel after a lot of research and were not really dissapointed. Rooms were fairly good clean and decent sized comapred to Paris standards. No Tea Coffee Maker in the room though. Right next to Gare De Lyon station so great connectivity. Lost of eating places around. The only flip side it did not have one of those 7- 11 s or Tesco type stores close by. Also next to the hotel is a Sex shop and parlour not the best things to have but otherwise the neighbourhood was decent. We used to come back very late at night and never faced any problems. Staff at reception was very helpful you can book Lido tickets from here itself. The Resturant staff and room service staff was non existant though. Once and the only once wanted to order Coffee in the room -- room service did not pick up so I went down and had to lug the coffee upstairs myself !!

Reviews.Title: “At last, a European hotel with an accurate star rating”
Reviews.Author: Matt873
Reviews.Content: I have always thought that you need to remove one star (at least) from the ratings of European hotels to get an accurate picture. Well, the Holiday Inn Bastille deserves (at least) its three star rating. It is advertised as comfortable, clean, well located and reasonable value and it fulfills these claims. The hotel is well located, being walking distance from Gare de Lyon and within a lively, restaurant-filled area of central Paris. Rooms are clean, nicely furnished and well maintained. Staff are friendly and without attitude (this is not always the case in Paris hotels!). Overall, a positive experience and refreshing that you can indeed get what is advertised in the European hotel sector.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Gare du Lyon”
Reviews.Author: uk_hotel_expert
Reviews.Content: Convenient location, clean and quiet plus descent sized rooms. However, it's often pricey for a Holiday Inn and the Breakfast is abismal (expensive at €16 each, poor selection, poor quality). A taxi will cost you about €17 from Gare du Nord to this location or you can take RER D. Air conditioning is only average.

Reviews.Title: “good bisness hotel”
Reviews.Author: dtshura
Reviews.Content: the hotel looks much better after renovation. Very elegant rooms, and nice breakfast, which is quite rare for Paris. Great location. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Functional, close to station, but wouldn't return.”
Reviews.Author: thesaurus23
Reviews.Content: Room was very small, you could hardly walk round the bed. Bathroom door hit the toilet, it was so cramped. Reception rude and unhelpful. Top floor rooms are in the eaves so even smaller. Plumbing from above woke us at midnight with terrible gurgles coming from our bathroom, the drains must have been blocked.. but I imagine it's not the first time that's happened.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprise; a good option for many”
Reviews.Author: Worlds_of_Wonder
Reviews.Content: I selected this Holiday Inn despite its seemingly less desirable location because it was more affordable, relatively speaking, than many other hotel options. I was worried because of its proximity to the Gare de Lyon and, from other Trip Advisor reviewers, some questionable establishments in the proximity. My worries were unwarranted. This hotel proved to be a winner in many ways. First, it is well situated-20 minutes or so, by foot, to Place Bastille where there are many activities, restaurants, and cafes; 40-60 minutes, by foot, to Notre Dame; and 10-15 minutes from the Canal Paris Arsenal. Second, it is very close to several metro stations, the Gare de Lyon, and the Rue de Rivoli. Third, it has been recently remodeled and thus the lobby and rooms (or at least my room) were in good shape (modern, clean, and well featured). Fourth, there is a movie theatre across the street. Fifth, one can get a bus directly to CDG Roissy airport from the Gare de Lyon. The TV offerings are limited, but why watch when you are in Paris! Service was passable and helpful, though not always warm. Housekeeping was a bit forgetful, though solid. The hotel's free wireless is ok-slow, but usable. I did not eat in the hotel or use the hotel bar. All-in-all, this hotel definitely will get my consideration in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location for tourism”
Reviews.Author: LOCHINDAAL
Reviews.Content: My husband treated me to a long weekend in Paris and asked me to book accommodation. As I am a Priority Card holder and my French is a bit ropey I thought I would stay in an 'international' hotel that would probably have English speaking staff and earn me points at the same time. The reception staff were very friendly and mostly helpful, although when my husband asked if the staff could recommend somewhere to eat one evening the woman just shrugged and looked disinterested. The hotel was clean and just what you would expect from a holiday inn, I think the price of the room was on par with other similar starred hotels in Paris. The bathroom was a little strange, our shower didn't have a curtain around it over the bath but as the bathroom floor had a drain in it, we assumed it was a wet room. Only on the last day did the maid put a curtain up. The smoke alarm is right outside the bathroom door so steam and spray deodorant sets off the smoke alarm, weirdly this was isolated otoour room and didn't actually set off the main hotel alarm (although this did go off on our last night whilst we were paying our bill - completely unfazed the night reception guy who proceeded to process my credit card and the phone was ringing and people were flying downstairs in a panic thinking there was a real fire!!!) We went for a late drink in a nearby cafe whilst the fire alarm was sorted, when we returned to the hotel at about 1am, I asked the same receptionist guy if he could book us a cab for 5.30am as we had to get to the station to get the RER to the airport. He wrote it down on a piece of paper. After a short bit of shut eye, we were down at reception ready to go at 5.30. There was no taxi waiting and the guy said we shouldn't expect a taxi to take us anywhere as they were all very busy!!!! Eventually we asked him to flag down a taxi who had to use his sat nav to find a well known RER station just 2 miles away. Very odd. All in all we had a thoroughly enjoyable time and I would recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel great location highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: DrCro
Reviews.Content: This hotel was nice in every way. You can access all of paris though the subways that are close by. Very clean and good air conditioning for the summer. Staff was very friendly. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: Pixiematic
Reviews.Content: I always return to this hotel when I m travelling on business in Paris. Location, location, location. Extremely convenient for public transportation. The hotel itself is in good shape, rooms are in good shape recently refurbished. In that price range, it is a no brainer for me

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but not 4* hotel”
Reviews.Author: AlexC_RO
Reviews.Content: I went to Paris for a week with family to visit Disney-land. We decided to stay at this hotel due to its proximity to RER A train, and the fact we could book a suite for same points as a standard room (an earlier online offer). The hotel is very close to Gare de Lyon, and around it there are plenty of bistros and pubs where one can enjoy lunch, dinner or even just a drink with friends. The only negative point about the location is that there is a Sex Shop which shares the ground floor with the hotel, almost blocking the entrance and definitely more visible that the HI. This is not setting up the right expectations if you travel with family :) At check-in we were advised that our room has been assigned to somebody else; we have been moved to an Executive Room and offered free breakfast as compensation. Travelling with a small child and being aware of breakfast quality at other HI hotels, we took the deal, I was not in a mood for argueing. Staff was very curteous and gave us all necessary information. The room was on 3rd floor and was the largest room on the floor (317). However, it was the smallest hotel room I have ever stayed in, and definitely not something one could call "Executive Room". With a roll-away bed in the room, we only had physical space to keep the luggage on the floor, even the small hall-way was full with the baby-stroller. The bathroom was 1m away from the bed, sepparated from the room by glass doors. It was so small that the door only opened 45 degrees before bumping into the toilet seat :) The room had all amenities you would expect from a 4* room/hotel (LCD TV, fridge, tea/coffee station, bedlights, etc), but due to the size you could not really tell it is an upgrade from standard room. The quality of the furniture and bed was high, and everything was working very well. Internet is free at this proprety, a very big plus for us who wanted to keep in touch with the family and the world. Breakfast was the biggest dissapointment for us at this hotel. I was expecting a full range of starters (yoghurt, salami, vedgetables, cheese, etc), accompanied by the standard range of hot offerings (eggs, bacon, sausages, etc). I stayed at several HIs in UK before and they all offered a much better breakfast. The offer was very similar to breakfast at a Holiday Inn Express, with only lukewarm scrambled eggs and a thin array of other food. For bread they only served "baguettes", completely useless if you want to have a proper toast sandwich in the morning. We did not have dinner at the hotel, but the prices were very friendly, compared to the bistro's nearby. Overall we enjoyed our stay, but this was not due to the hotel. If on business trip I would book it again, assuming price is right. For family trips I would look for a larger room or a more central location.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: anilghei
Reviews.Content: walking distance from gare de lyon- ideal for people arriving from other cities in europe.loaction is great with lovely cafes lining bastille and rue de lyon. nice rooms , though a bit small. metro staion closeby. good breakfast.with wide selection, attentive service, good housekeeping too

Reviews.Title: “Good, well priced comfortable hotel, above average Holiday Inn.”
Reviews.Author: golfrunner800
Reviews.Content: This was a good choice for the work that I had to do nearby at the Bercy Omnisports Arena (10 -15 minute walk). Nice room and bathroom, if a little on the small side. Breakfast was 16 euro as I had a room only deal and was just about worth it although you can get a coffee and croissant nearby for a lot less. The hotel is located 3 minutes walk from the Gare de Lyon and there are no shortage of decent restaurants (L'Europeen the pick of them) and bars within 200 metres and the airport bus is only a 2 minute walk away. All in all, a good choice in a fairly bustling location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: SmilingSalmon
Reviews.Content: We just spent 2 weeks on vacation in Paris. I researched hotels for a long time in order to find a hotel that would provide a quiet night's rest and be convenient to the Metro and trains. We finally settled on the Holiday Inn Bastille, and we were not disappointed. This hotel was perfect for our needs. Our room was in the back so there was no street noise, and we could see the top half of the Eiffel Tower from our window, along with some beautiful sunsets. The room was comfortable (although small) with tea and coffee service, water and juice. The WIFI was free and worked beautifully. Our only complaint on the room was that it did not have a shower curtain so we made quite a mess when taking showers. The hotel is very close to Gare de Lyon and the Metro which made travel very convenient. We bought a Paris Pass which provided unlimited public transportation, and we used it extensively. There were many cafes and restaurants of different price ranges in the area around the hotel or within a stop or 2 on the Metro. This hotel was a nice, quiet oasis from the chaotic sightseeing we were doing, and when our vacation was over, the AirFrance shuttle stopped right outside the train station and took us back to the airport. To sum things up, this hotel is great for a business trip or sightseeing vacation, not necessarily as a destination hotel. We didn't spend much time there during the day but it was really nice to come back to after a full day of sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for Gare du Lyon”
Reviews.Author: Marks069
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here three times in the last year or so. The hotel has been recently refurbished, is in a quiet location, very convenient for the Gare du Lyon, and the rooms are comfortable. On two of the occasions we were upgraded (as members of Priority Club) and therefore had the benefit of tea and coffee facilities in the room. On the other occasion, when we were not upgraded, I was disappointed not to have tea and coffee facilities. The staff have always been helpful and friendly. The breakfast when we have eaten there has been of a good standard in a very pleasant dining room. Overall, a good experience, and one of our hotels of choice when travelling to the South.

Reviews.Title: “You know the quality will be good”
Reviews.Author: taylor339
Reviews.Content: I booked the Holiday Inn Bastille for an anniversary break. I wanted to know I was getting a decent quality place and have always had previous good experiences staying at Holiday Inns. During my information search, I was consistently reading good reports about this hotel plus the rooms were quiet. On arriving, I was not disappointed - I had pre ordered flowers for the room which they obliged with and were all quick to help out with any questions we had. Our room, 620, was a King Size leisure and the room was spacious, shower was very good, it had a fridge with complimentary water and orange juice and TV with usual English news channels. We could see the top half of the Eiffel Tower from the bedroom which was an added bonus! Breakfast was a buffet style which consisted of cereals, continental and English breakfast bits. Coffee was okay and they had an expresso machine but the tea wasnt PG tips. We didn't try the bar as there were plenty of cafes and bars around anyway to the Gare De Lyon. This is a stones through away - right out of reception and 400m in front of you. All in all a very safe bet.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend break”
Reviews.Author: zac_kn45
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a weekend break in Paris. The hotel was pretty good value for money. The rooms were a bit cramped and our view was into back of some other buildings, but on the other hands they were clean and fairly quiet. They lack tea/coffee making facilities which was slightly disappointing. We didn't try the buffett breakfast since we felt it was slightly expensive, but plenty of cafes are in the vicinity. There is also a bakery which does fresh pastries in the mornings near the hotel. Also beware there are no restaurants in the hotel itself though they do have a failry limited room service menu which shuts down by midnight if I recall correctly (but again, not much of a problem since there is a cafe few mins down the street which was still open at 0045 when we went there) Location wasn't quite bad. The closest metro is probably Gare du Lyon but we found it was a maze to navigate and some parts of it wasn't exactly pleasant. Bastille is slightly a longer walk down Rue De Lyon but it is not complicated. Overall good value for money in expensive Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: buffysnee
Reviews.Content: Don't let the exterior fool you. When you pull up in a taxi and see a Sex Shop next door, that's not indicative of the neighborhood or the hotel. Obviously recently renovated, the interior is palatial, by European standards. Our 2-twin-bed room had room to walk around both beds, a full tub and large bathroom, and table and chair. The wireless internet was included in the rate - huge cost savings for multi-day travel! There's a small grocery store in the next block, and a nice creperie across the street. It's 2 blocks from Gare de Lyon, and about 8 or so blocks to the Bastille. The breakfast was complete, altho expensive. We ate there once - the other days we just wandered a few blocks and found a cafe or boulangerie. The staff was wonderful and spoke perfect English - really not what I was expecting as an American in Paris for the first time! And they had a room ready for us at about 11AM - very helpful for international travel! The best part - we were on the 1st floor (2nd floor to Americans), and we did not hear any street or hallway noise. Comfy beds and standard Holiday Inn bedding. Stay away from the cafes and restaurants near the Gare de Lyon - they are touristy and the food isn't as good. An excellent location - I would easily stay here again until I can afford George V... :)

Reviews.Title: “Good if you travel by train though the Gare de Lyon”
Reviews.Author: JMGeneva
Reviews.Content: Used to go to this hotel regularly, its location is just perfect if you travel through the Gare de Lyon, it's also convenient fort the Bastille area, and even for the Marais if you like to walk, however it's a bit less practical for most central Paris attractions. The rooms are nice and, although not very large they're not ridiculously small, beds are OK. The service is quite basic, and we were not too happy when coming back at 3 AM to read the small note on the -closed - door saying that the night clerk was "doing some regular maintenance in the upper floors for 15 minutes", not exactly what you want to see when you want to go to bed... This hotel shows substantial price variations, if you' find a good price, then it may be quite convenient and reasonably comfortable choice.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal”
Reviews.Author: Iknowgoodfood1
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel at a really good price, I have no idea why maybe it was off season. Generally nice rooms, we liked the bathroom door... inspired... Good value for money... close to Bastille and Les Marais. Sometimes staff can be a bit weird....

Reviews.Title: “Updated Holiday Inn at Gare du Lyon”
Reviews.Author: getmarshall
Reviews.Content: Just stayed one night as my train arrived late in the evening at Gare de Lyon. Check in was smooth and painless. Paid the night with Priority Points, so everything was on file. I was upgraded to an executive room which was a corner room so it was quite spacious. Nice comfy bed and work area. WIFI worked good. Bathroom was very tiny even for Paris standards. Wasn't awful for one person, but man it was tight. Checked out early the next morning which again was very easy. Overall a nice hotel and definitely would stay again if I needed to be in this area of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Inn Paris Bastille”
Reviews.Author: gawab
Reviews.Content: Comfortable, large rooms, which is rare for a 3 star hotel in Paris, good design, comfortable beds, spacious, roomy wardrobe. Convenient location, near many good restaurants, Gare de Lyon, the Seine. A good hotel for the price / quality ratio.

Reviews.Title: “Good Holiday Inn, Good Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: roamingmatt
Reviews.Content: POSITIVES - Good hotel for the price range - Convenient location for many subway lines to go all over Paris, walk to Bastille/Le Marais or to catch a train from Gare de Lyon. - Efficient, clean, friendly - Nice room - Great bed, with various different pillows - Hot breakfast (good if you don't want just a typical croissant for breakfast), but it did cost 16 euros. - Free Wi-Fi. Some reviewers said Wi-Fi is expensive but it's actually free (the free version has limited bandwidth but it worked OK. Plus you have to re-login every hour; you can keep signing up with the same details again and again). NEGATIVES - Train station neighbourhood with few tourist attractions - You have to keep logging into the Wi-Fi every hour - Not the most "charmingly Parisian" hotel (but it is an unusually nice Holiday Inn)

Reviews.Title: “Roomy and Relaxed”
Reviews.Author: jaynetom
Reviews.Content: Here for two nights with business colleagues. We were greeted warmly upon arrival and quickly booked in. My room was on the sixth floor over looking the Rue de Lyon. The room large and spacious as it was a suite, with additional lounge and television. Both the decor and cleanliness of the room were to a good standard. Room service was reliable. Buffet style breakfast was hot and well presented. Ideally located within walking distance of the Train Station.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, excellent breakfast, modern room”
Reviews.Author: jfmelle
Reviews.Content: I've been at the Holiday Inn Bastille for 4 days in vacation in January 2011 with my wife. The location is great. One block away from Gare de Lyon (large metro and train station), meaning that you can go to almost anywhere in Paris with public transportation, and safely. The hotel seems to have been recently refurbished. The room I got was at the sixth floor. King size bed, LCD TV, good heating system. Room is not that big. But considering that you are in Paris and will spend not much time in there, it really doesn't matter. Mattress was confortable, as well as pillows. There could be some more space for luggage/ clothes. Bathroon was also refurbished. Again, sink area could be larger, but it was not that bad. Good heating system at the bathroom. Shower was new and good. My wife didn't like the hair dryer, that was quite unsual, but nothing that would make you choose another hotel. Breakfast was included, and very good, with hot dishes, different types of cheeses, and different types of coffees (Nespresso, american...).

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with wonderful Parisian flair”
Reviews.Author: shawnie27
Reviews.Content: I honestly cannot understand how there can be any negative reviews on this hotel. The value, cleanliness and location cannot be matched! The hotel is down the street from the Gare de Lyon and the metro by which you can get to all the Paris attractions in under 15 min, you cannot beat the location, unless you are staying on the Champs Elysees, in which case you would not be looking at this place anyway! All in all great rooms, lobby and friendly attentive, english speaking staff! If looking for perfection please be sure to at 300euro to your average nightly stay. However, for those looking for a moderately priced, decent hotel, this most certainly fits the bill, hands down

Reviews.Title: “Not that great”
Reviews.Author: BeingUs
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in Jul '10. Very tiny room. No view to speak of. Bath tub did not drain properly, but did not complain about it. Breakfast was too expensive so had it everyday at a lovely cafe nearby (delicious croissants!). Walking distance to the Gare de Lyon station. Would we stay here again?...only for the proximity to the station. But all in all, cant complain much about the place, just that in comparison to other places we stayed during our trip, this was least comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel which deserves its three stars, and maybe half a star more”
Reviews.Author: gezgin_dromedary
Reviews.Content: Holiday Inn Bastille is actually about 500 meters from Bastille square and about 50 meters from Gare de Lyon. Its location is very convenient given that it is within 5 minute walking distance to the Gare de Lyon metro station, and Paris metro line 1 directly connects you to Champs Elysees or Louvre Museum. Our room was small but comfortable, and had a very small balcony overlooking Rue de Lyon. The bathroom was also ok, but was seperated from the room by a glass wall, and did not give much of a feeling of privacy. The breakfast was quite good, there was a satisfactory selection of bread, cheese, fresh fruit and cereals. The reception and breakfast room personnel was not exactly friendly, but they were polite and were doing their jobs well enough. Overall, I would recommend this hotel as long as you don't mind having a 15-20 minute metro ride to reach pleasant Paris neighborhoods such as Champ Elysees or Saint Germain. If you believe however, that Paris subway system is too complicated for you, stay at some other hotel which is more centrally located.

Reviews.Title: “overrated”
Reviews.Author: alzoy
Reviews.Content: We found the Holiday Inn Bastille, Paris over- priced, overrated, serving average breakfast which again was highly priced!The staff too seemed ill informed and was unhelpful about queries regarding travel in Paris and visits to attractions there.Only thing to recommend it was it's location; very close to the Gar de Lyon station.Overall a wasteful place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Decent room in a great location--but be sure you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: mollybecky
Reviews.Content: I was here for business for five nights in a very busy time in Paris. The good news--the rooms are very good and are very reasonably priced for the Paris area. Very well-located, only a couple of blocks away from the Gare du Nord and within walking distance of all of the sights. Plenty of nice cafes and a grocery store across the street. Overall, I was not at all impressed with the front desk service or housekeeping (very late in cleaning the rooms every day). Also, even though I had reserved and paid in advance for an executive room, I was placed in a regular room (still nice but small). After letting the staff know, they placed me in the correct room without any acknowledgment of their error.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: KBScotland
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on 2 night reward deal, fantastic location, great hotel, one of the best HI's we've ever stayed in. Very minor problem with our original room, reception moved us to another executive room on a lower floor with a view to the main street, no sound problems due to very effective double glazing, so much so we almost slept in the first morning. Can't fault this hotel at all, and that's unusual for me! Forget about the sex shop next door, it's not a problem, we went in out of curiosity (honestly, nothing else!) and didn't find anything offensive, in fact we had a bit of banter with the shopkeeper which was a laugh. Breakfast wasn't included in our room so we can't comment on that, we went to the first cafe you come to when you exit the hotel to your left, found the staff there very friendly and helpful with our poor french. Same cafe is open till 0200 each night, handy for a nightcap. Would definitely return to this hotel and area. Perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Very Good Hotel. I surely recommend...”
Reviews.Author: Cuiabano
Reviews.Content: Great location, close to Gare de Lyon, restaurants and market. Very good hotel. Good price. I would certainly stay again...

Reviews.Title: “Great location! Super staff!”
Reviews.Author: noemhouse
Reviews.Content: This hotel was booked on the fly - actually from the top of a double decker bus while in Paris. It was a GREAT hotel in a super location. We'd stay back in this quint neighborhood in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely appointed hotel - make sure you get what you paid for”
Reviews.Author: Eklondon
Reviews.Content: I thought this was a very nice hotel - the finishings are quite clean and modern in the midst of a lot of second rate hotels. The location was certainly very convenient - you can take the RER just two stops from Gare du Nord. The reception originally put us in a small, cramped room in a back corner with just a double bed. However, I had booked a king sized bed and thankfully made a point to say something. The room they moved us into was FAR superior and that somewhat annoys me that they tried to get away with putting us in a lesser room. However, I will say the room with the king sized bed was lovely, and as the other posts comment - it was very quiet even though it was street facing. I would stay there again, although it's not a bargain - it's good for it's price.

Reviews.Title: “No free WIFI - No coffee maker - No iron & ironing board - No parking”
Reviews.Author: Betabloke
Reviews.Content: pro's located near gare de Lyon, Metro, public bike rental clean rooms rooms at back of hotel are quiet and sleep was great cons standard rooms are small, just enough room to maneuver around the bed. would not recommend for a longer stay you have to pay for WIFI (8 euros for one hour acces or 18 for 24 hours) no in room coffee maker, no iron & ironing board park off site near gare de Lyon approx 30 euros 24 hours 175 euros a night excluding breakfast and above amenities is not really a good deal

Reviews.Title: “Decent and reliable Holiday Inn hotel”
Reviews.Author: HT-Birmingham
Reviews.Content: A good average decent holiday inn. Location was excellent with a 5 minute walk from the main entrance of Gare de Lyon. Check in was good and I had booked an Exec room, but with my Platinum Priority Club membership upgraded to a suite on the 7th floor. Reception staff were always friendly and always greeted with a Bonjour/hello when walking past. The lobby area was clean and quite modern. As other people have stated there are two lifts, only one which goes to the 7th floor. The suite I was upgraded to was quite big, clean, and offered great great views over the rooftops of Paris. The only downside I would say is that it was nice to be upgraded to a suite, it felt like the room was missing items you would expect from a suite:- - No upgraded toiletries - “Complimentary drinks and small cake” not replaced every day - No bathrobes/ slippers - No stationary i.e. pens, paper, envelopes - Not even the used milk was replaced Breakfast was included in the rate and was average and offered a good choice. Free internet and printing was offered by 2 computers in the lobby, which were helpful when checking in for flights. I would stay here again if the price was right, as I see it as a reliable average hotel to stay in while in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: ED46
Reviews.Content: I was a little unsure of the location of this hotel at first as there is a sex shop next door, but was pleasantly surprised (No issues with the street or people hanging around). Reasonably priced, lovely reception area and well appointed rooms. The king size bed was very comfortable, with black out curtains and no noise from the street or other rooms/corridor. The bathroom clean and shower hot. The staff were friendly and helpful. They were happy to speak in English, and accepted our attempts in French! Not sure why it's called 'Holiday Inn Bastille', as it's alot closer to Gare de Lyon. Easy walking distance to main attractions and close to Metro stops. We didn't have breakfast included, but there are lots of cafes/restaurants in the area. Overal an enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Gare de Lyon Location/Holiday Inn Bastille”
Reviews.Author: Rosita1124
Reviews.Content: Did extensive research before booking this hotel and based upon input from other recent travelers selected this accomodation. It was perfect for our needs. 2 night stay with my sister. Had a lovely room (small as indicated in other reviews but well set up and very functional with a delightful bath). Also, a terrace view from 5th floor up and down Rue de Lyon. Would definitely stay again and recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations - Nice property next to Gare de Lyon”
Reviews.Author: ottwatrvlr
Reviews.Content: Holiday Inn properties are usually not my first choice when travelling overseas but as I had access to a discounted rate, I decided to give it a try. Staff at check-in were very friendly, reviewing on site amenities and taking their time (ie not rushing) through check-in. The lobby has somewhat of a modern look to it. The "business centre" which features two computers with internet access (free) are located next to the front desk. The hotel has two elevators - only one of which makes it to the top (7th floor). We were provided with a King Executive room which is located on the 7th floor. I usually like staying on the top floor so this was good. However, as this is an older building, you do loose some space/heights as the roofside/ceiling/wall is at an angle for part of the room. This is actually somewhat dangerous as one side of the bed is on that lower ceiling side and one would easily bump into the wall/window at night. This is really the only "design flaw" for those rooms. Other than that, the room was great as far as space, bed comfort and other amenities. We had booked two rooms at this hotel which were fairly identical with the exception of the washrooms. One had a bath + flexible showerhead but no fictures for the showerhead and no walls to prevent water from splashing everywhere. The other washroom was more traditional with fixed height showerhead and plastic sheet/cover to minimize splashing. We did not have breakfast at this hotel as we prefered to try one of the nearby cafe. The hotel is within walking distance of Gare de Lyon (straight line, about 5 minutes). If you need to do laundry, there are 2-3 laundromat within a 5 minutes walking distance of the hotel. Gare d'Austerlitz and Jardin des Plantes would be within walking distance (15 minutes). Notre-Dame-de-Paris is approx. 20-30 minutes away. For the right price, I would not hesitate staying in the area again

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, quite good but not great.”
Reviews.Author: chaucer10
Reviews.Content: Having read the rave reviews, I was expecting an amazing hotel. Well, it wasn't bad but it wasn't, as someone said, the best thing about Paris! It was simply a comfortable hotel, well positioned with nice, quiet rooms. Just what you need in Paris. THE PROS Great location - Right near to Gare de Lyons so very easy to get around. Top tip, if you're coming from London via Eurostar, buy your metro tickets at Kings Cross (you get them once you pass through customs) - otherwise you'll have to stand at a massive queue at Gare du Nord. Get the D line - it's just two stops from Gare du Nord to Gare de Lyon so it's really not worth getting a taxi. The Price - A great price for Paris, some hotels nearer to the centre really do charge ridiculously high prices just because of their central location. This is only 4 or 5 metro stops from the Louvre so just a hop, skip and a jump. The Silence - Wonderfully quiet rooms. We've stayed in Paris loads of times and love the atmosphere but if your room overlooks a busy street, then sometimes the atmosphere can be a little tiring, especially at 3 in the morning! The rooms here were lovely and quiet. The Rooms - Large comfortable beds, fair size bathrooms. Nothing special, simply comfortable. The Staff - Some of the reception staff were lovely, one though was, urm, see below. CONS The Booking - Ring up the day before to check they've got your reservation. We did do this and they confirmed it but when we arrived, quite late, they said that the company credit card hadn't been accepted. Turned out, they simply hadn't got the expiry date so all turned out OK in the end but a little surprised that they hadn't mentioned this on the phone the day before. A member of staff - At the reception desk, we carried out the credit card discussion in French until, a little tired and running out of French vocab, I asked if the receptionist spoke English. "If I have to," he said. I like to think he had a dry sense of humour but I'm not so sure. He was the only member of the reception staff who really didn't seem particularly happy to be there! The rest of them were great. Breakfast - Not worth the price - also forget breakfast in bed, our's was late by 45 mins. Not so bad if you're on holiday, not so good if you're working! The Rooms - Bedrooms are brown so a bit dark and dingy. I reckon you're better off asking for a room as far up as possible then you'll get some natural light. We were on the 1st and 2nd floors which were rather dark - but at least they were quiet!

Reviews.Title: “Well appointed rooms in great location”
Reviews.Author: denmoz
Reviews.Content: Although the room was a little small, it wasextremely well appointed, airconditioned and with a wonderful king size bed and a fairly large bathroom. The hotel is in a great location - a 2 min wlk from Gare de Lyon raiway/metro station in one direction, a 5min walk in other direction to the lively Bastille area with its numerous cafes and restaurants, a supermarket almost opposite, a patisserie on same side of street as hotel about 100m down towards Bastille where you can get breakfast cheaply (try their croque de monsieur) and several restaurants nearby( but there is a bigger and better selection in the Bastille area) There is also a fabulous market Sun and Tue morning near the roundabout at Bastille with wonderful produce, clothing, trickets etc) We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Good location & Great Value”
Reviews.Author: vonbondies
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel at the start of August for 4 nights with 2 friends and this hotel was perfect for our needs. We were given a room on the 4th floor (room 417 I think) which had two single beds pushed together and a fold away bed already set up for us. The room was a decent size and was enough for 3 girls to get ready in, the room came with coffee making facilities, a safe and fridge...my friends were a bit annoyed that there were only 3 english channels on the tv but as we didn't really send that much time in the hotel I don't think that was too much of an issue! The bathroom was also a decent size, the only downside was the bathroom doors. The doors were frosted glass, but you could pretty much see right through them, so there was not really a lot of privacy. The location is prefect just a short walk to Gare De Lyon where you can take a short ride on the underground and be in the heart of the city. We didn't eat breakfast in the hotel as it was a bit to expensive for us but there are plenty of places in the area to eat and also a small food store across the street. Overall I would stay in this hotel again the staff were friendly and the location was fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Great Location Great Service !”
Reviews.Author: dbear25
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for 2 nights as a stop over on our travels to the south of France . We choose this particular hotel due it's proximity to Gare de Lyon train station (500meters away) , Bastille and Notre Dame. We were not disappointed and after a very short €8 cab fare from Gare De Nore we were pulling up outside a very nice looking building . The reception area was decorated lovely and it took all of 5 mins to be checked in our room was on the 3rd floor (314 I think) and this faced out towards the back of the hotel which was very quiet so although no spectacular views we both got goods night sleep. The hotel as just been though a refurb and it showed the hallways were decorated well and the lights above each room came on as you walked past them. The room we had was small but perfectly formed with a TV (BBC world /CNN news only English channels), safe, full length mirror and well stocked bathroom. The bed was firm and pillows ok and the air con was easy to work, with two wardrobes either side of the bed there was no arguments for hangers ! There was a hair-dryer in the bathroom which worked well however my only gripe was the fact the cord was too short so i had to turn and face the wall to dry the other side of my head . Reception were very helpful giving directions to a restaurant we booked in the Latin quarter and advised us of breakfast facilities etc but we decided to eat outside the hotel and find our own food . Across the road from the hotel (50meters) is a Monop which has a good choice of food, snacks, wine and water which would suggest you buy from there as the mini bar was €5 for a small bottle !! The stunning Notre Dame was a 25 min walk along the river and the Pantheon was approx 40 mins. We even walked to the Eiffel Tower one day obviously it took quite a while however with the sun shining and lots of things / places to see on your way the time went by quickly. If walking seems a little to much then there were shuttle boats picking up people from various stops along the river or there are Bikes that you can hire from various points along the river bank which from memory were pretty inexpensive. Best part about the hotel is the closeness to Gare De Lyon just perfect ! worst ....I can't seem to think of anything apart from the hair-dryer cord so all in all a great place to stay !

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Really Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: bhaskar_desai
Reviews.Content: The first hotel of our trip. Location is great and staff very friendly and helpful. Made us feel right at home and comfortable in a new city. Breakfast is great so always book with breakfast included. One negative was there was no tea of coffee in the room. Hope the hotel management fixes this. A delightful hotel in a fabulous city.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel great location great time”
Reviews.Author: tddentx
Reviews.Content: Well located near Gare de Lyon (2 min walk) - so fantastic access to all of Paris's superb public transport system Next to a sex shop....but v discreet and hey this is Paris!!!! Rooms good size always cleaned daily. Breakfast fine just what we needed to see us through a hectic day of sightseeing and then crash out at the end of the day. Front desk staff were fine and helpful. We had rooms at the front on the 1st and 2nd floor but no noise issues for us. Overall no probs and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel near TGV”
Reviews.Author: Happydutchman
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay here (previous time was four years ago). In the meantime they have refurbished the hotel, and it is now definitely hip (while still being practical). Because of my priority club membership was upgraded to the executive rooms on the sixth floor. My room was quiet; they do have rooms away from the road Rue de Lyon, although that road is not exceptionally busy by Paris standards. Rooms are a bit small, but similar to what you can expect in Paris. Breakfast was included in my rate and very good; paying full price for it would be a bit much. There are excellent connections by metro and RER to all parts of Paris from the Bastille and Gare de Lyon. Talking of high speed trains the IDTGV.com website sometimes gives rates earlier than the TGV-Europe.com site (usual is three months in advance; IDTGV is sometimes earlier and has cheaper prices). If you can afford it, consider first class in the IDTGV train; it has much more space.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with a good location!”
Reviews.Author: backpackHelsinki
Reviews.Content: This hotel was situated just few steps from the train station and a short walk to the metro station. There are also lot of restaurants in this area. This was a basic hotel with clean rooms and friendly staff, there is nothing bad to say about this place.

Reviews.Title: “All around good paris hotel”
Reviews.Author: aussietravelcat
Reviews.Content: This was a pretty good hotel. We were impressed with the room design and although somewhat small, they were a good size for a Paris hotel. Location is good. Dbl glazed windows blocked most of the noise. Breakfast was standard. Good, clean choice for Paris.

Reviews.Title: “A++ Location, Underrated Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: AdventureMan123
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the surprise of the trip. For Paris it was very reasonably priced which along with the location is why I booked it.
