However, turns out it's right next to the train station which was even better, AND had an extrordinary appeal. The rooms were extremely clean, attentively decorated and full of amenities. Service was good, but we didn't get much chance to even use it. The location easily gave us the ability to double the amount of activities were were able to do in a day at 1/10th of the price of taxis in Paris. If you are brave enough to navigate the train system then you can save loads of both time and money. Taxis are subject to traffic, and even though we had a rental car, good luck finding or fighting for parking in Paris. Take the train, and since the hotel is right on the train route than runs along the Avenue des Champs-Élysées most tourists will be very pleased with the location. With the Louvre, shopping and other sights just 3 minutes by train life is good there. There are two small hints to keep in mind though. First, parking...there is none, you have to park at the train station which is pretty expensive at 25€/day. Second, breakfast is cheaper at the train station and there are wonderful pastry/bakeries there that offer many things. The hotel was a bit pricey for breakfast so we never opted to eat there. Try the Flan Custard Pie thing from the train station, it's awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Interesting location but small rooms....don't pay too much”
Reviews.Author: Pinky_and_Brain
Reviews.Content: When we stayed in August 2009 the hotel was still undergoing refurbishment and the breakfast area was still under construction. Hopefully by the time you read this it will all be finished. LOCATION -Despite its name the hotel is actually much closer to "Gare de Lyon" than to "Place de la Bastille". If you are taking an early morning train from this station this is a good hotel to be in. It’s literally less than 10 minutes from the hotel entrance to the train station platforms. TGV high speed trains to Cannes and Nice leave from here. -Closest metro (subway, underground) station is "Gare de Lyon" where you can get the purple coloured metro line 14 the and the yellow coloured line number 1. RER lines A and D also run though this station. If you're going to either of the airports or gare du nord Eurostar terminal you will need to change lines. Alternatively you can walk down "Rue de Lyon" to "Place de la Bastille" where metro line 5 (orange colour) goes direct to gare du nord. -There is a beautiful restaurant inside the "Gare de Lyon" train station called "Le Train Bleu" with stunning interiors from the year 1900 where you feel like you're dining in a royal palace ! There are also many restaurants and shops in the "Place de la Bastille" area. -Unfortunately the hotel is literally right next door to a sex toy & video shop. Despite this its not a bad area of town at all. ROOMS -Rooms have recently been renovated and look good and everything is new, but despite this, they are still quite small. Windows can be opened which is a plus. Top floor rooms have views over the rooftops of Paris. -Because the hotel was undergoing refurbishment in August 2009 we got 3 free soft drinks in the minibar which was a nice gesture. STAFF -There was only one person behind reception. COMMON AREAS -This is an old building from 1913 and still has some very old features which are lovely. However, probably due to laws prohibiting radical changes in such listed buildings the lift/elevator is tiny and from what I could see they only had one. It’s fine if you're 2 people with one piece of luggage but for a hotel with over 125 rooms it's a nightmare. You're better off taking the stairs. -Breakfast is 16 euro per person. We declined as there were many places nearby with better and cheaper options. -Some parts of the hotel looked quite empty...perhaps they were ordering some new furniture after the refurbishment. PRICE Rooms at this hotel are often quite expensive so make sure you shop around. 100 to 150 euro for one night seems way overpriced considering the non central area and small rooms. Holiday Inn itself has over 20 hotels in Paris so check alternatives. It’s a decent hotel but unless you need to be in this area or get a really good deal, stay somewhere else if you're planning to see central Paris for more than 2 days.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fab staff”
Reviews.Author: dtridley
Reviews.Content: Hotel recently renovated and looks great. Rooms not huge, but larger than average Parisian hotel rooms. Staff very helpful and knowledgeable about local area. Location is just out of the main tourist sites, but only 10 mins on the Metro to the centre. 2 minutes walk from Gare de Lyon, 5 minutes walk to Place de Bastille. Perfect if coming from Eurostar (jump in the RER line D -- only 2 stops).

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Tidy, Excellent position, Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: tulambi
Reviews.Content: Great stuff. They are ready to help at any time. Very polite. The room was very good and with nice decoration. Also very clean. The hotel location is great is 50m from the metro/train station

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Property!”
Reviews.Author: matthewdrakenc
Reviews.Content: On our anniverary - loved staying here!! The property was convenient to sites and it was very pretty!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: pgreid
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights at the end of November or business/leisure. We were greeted warmly upon arrival and quickly booked in. Our room was on the seventh floor over looking the Rue de Lyon. The room large and spacious as it was a suite, so had an additional lounge with televeision. Both the decor and cleanlinesss of the room were to a good standard. Breakfast was a buffett style but with hot food as well. Location is midway between the Bastille and the Gare de Lyon, easy walking distance when arriving by RER at Gare de Lyon.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: tadpole1
Reviews.Content: Good location walking distance to train station. Nice staff, although when we entered our room it was not clean and the cleaning lady that came in to clean it was sick and coughing all over everything. The front desk did not seem to care about that. The elevator was not working the one morning and we had to carry a lot of luggage down stairs. Room was nice, hallways very narrow. There was a "sex shop" next to the hotel, but other than that it was a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, exceptional staff and convenient location”
Reviews.Author: elaine1733
Reviews.Content: All of the renovations on the hotel are finished and it's gorgeous. I would say by Paris standards you could give it 4 stars rather than 3. This was my 5th time in Paris and my favourite hotel by far. The rooms were big and comfy and immaculately cleaned. I was particularly impressed because we slept in a few days and they still made up the room for us later in the afternoon without us even having to ask. The staff at this hotel are so friendly, and go over and above to help us feel comfortable and ensured we enjoyed our stay. Our overall experience was far beyond our expectations. I would recommend this hotel to everyone and will definitely be coming back myself as well. This is a very well run hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Large Room, Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveler1234
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the end of Sep 2009 for 2 nights. Room: We had the King executive room. Being that we were in Europe, we did not expect an actual KING bed. But that is what we got - a large King bed and a large room for European standards. We had 2 year old travelling with us and it was more than comfortable. There was a balcony overlooking Rue de Lyon. The traffic noise was not really a problem if the windows are closed. The bathroom was very clean and it had a large tub/shower combo. Location: Excellent! Just walking distance to train station, Gare De Lyon. You can go many places from that station. Few doors down there is an internet cafe. And a few more doors down there is a great place for coffee and croissants in the morning. There is a grocery store, Monoprix, just across the street. Many restaurants within steps from hotel. Food: We did not try any of the food in the hotel as there are many restaurants/cafes/brassseries just steps away in all directions from the hotel. As you walk out from the hotel and walk left there is a cafe "A la ville de lyon" where we had 2 cafe au laits and 2 croissants in the mornings for about 10 euros. Room Service: We did not try the room service Staff: Staff was friendly and helpful. We had prepaid for 1 night and had used our reward points for the 2nd night. The reward night only allowed for a standard room but the manager had assured us to be able to stay in the same King Room for both nights. We really appreicated that since we were travelling with our 2 year old.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed in this Holiday Inn”
Reviews.Author: cassidy528
Reviews.Content: We arrived early and they gave us a room right away - with a thick plastic sheet over the window so we couldn't see out, or get fresh air by opening the window. The next morning, I was planning on sleeping in but couldn't because DIRECTLY outside our window they were sanding and banging the metal railing. I asked to changed rooms, which they did oblige us however; the front desk girl had and attitude and smirked when I said I wanted a room away from the construction; she was the one that put us in the first room and I'm sure she knew it was a bad room! I'd have to say 1/2 the staff was helpful, the other half would ignore you even if you were standing there waiting to ask them a question! On the Holiday Inn website it stated there were coffee makers and irons in all rooms, which is NOT true. My husband was there for a confernece and we had no iron. We asked for one the first day (from the same girl that checked us in) and never recieved one, only to be told later they were all gone and if we wanted one we would have to wait until someone returned one and then put a deposit of 20 euros until we gave it back. This was also true of the plug adaptor (we forgot ours) We had to pay 10 euros deposit for that, which we did get back. The Holiday Inn website also listed there was a business center and restuarant, which there is NOT. If we had known all of this ahead of time, that all this construction was going on we would have found another hotel. There is an internet cafe next door, plan on 1.50euros for 15 min, 2.50 euros for 30 min. They offered a drab breakfast buffet which we were never told about, I just happened to wander in on day 2 because I desperately needed coffee! They had scrambled eggs which were bland, hotdogs, meatballs, yucky not fully cooked bacon, lots of croissants, some fruit, yogurt cereal. I don't know what they were charging, they asked us if we had breakfast when we were checking out and I just said no because I heard them telling another couple checking in it was included. The room was tiny, as well as the bathroom,could only fit one person at a time although things were updated, the carpets were filthy! My feet got dirty walking around the room. The bed was comfortable though. The hotel is in a good location to the Gard de Lyon metro stop, it was a quick 5 min walk. There is a sex shop next door, but didn't really see any seedy people hanging around. If I were to visit Paris again, I probably would not stay here unless all the remodeling was done.

Reviews.Title: “brilliant”
Reviews.Author: KatherineMelbourne
Reviews.Content: This hotle was under renovations when we stayed there but it was still great. The rooms were wonderful, spacious, gorgeous little balcony, great bathroom, comfy beds, modern design. The staff were super friendly and helpful, the breakfast was delicious, great variety of food and drink. Good location, close to a train station and taxi rank. Cafes and restaurants near by.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel for an average price”
Reviews.Author: Bradfordboy56
Reviews.Content: Despite being advised by HI central reservations when booking early August, that all renovation had finished at the end July, when we arrived 14/8/09 for 4 nights the hotel was clad in scaffold, corrugated iron sheets and had a temporary entrance. Renovations to the ground floor meant no bar, no lounge, a very drab breakfast room off reception and for a hotel on 7 floors only one lift. The reception staff attitude was that this was all on their website (but not as I could see on the main HI website for this hotel) - they were not apologetic, despite my being a HI loyaly card holder. Not at all welcoming. So we only walked through to our room and spent no other time here. Needless to say we didnot take breakfast here, lots of cafes around the Bastille or Gare du Lyon. Not much help from staff either for parking although you can park on the street in August in Paris for free - if you can't find a space nearby, the Opera Bastille car park is €28 for 12 - 24 hours. Our room was fine, renovated, air conditioned but as some others comment, rooms are small - but it is central Paris So no complaints about the accommodation, good bed, flat screen TV with CNN, BBC and Eurosport in addition to French channels. Didnot use the internet but it is available, but expensive (strange when some HI offer free wireless!) The bathroom was spacious with a good shower over bath, but no screen or curtain, so it's hard not to saok the floor if you take a shower. If you have young children, be aware all windows open fully inward and an inquisitive child on a chair could fall out! Surprised H+S allow this in these hotels. We paid €125 / €99 per night, however the hotel does not display a tariff card and when I asked reception what the rates were, I was told it changed daily - all other hotels seem to show a tariff card however. Good location, near the Bastille and the Marais, 300 m from direct line from Bastille to Louvre, Champs Elysee etc and 100 m from Gare du Lyon. As others have said, don't be put off by the sex shop next door, it's not a seedy area. An average hotel for an average price, let down by poor service and currently, very poor public areas. Might be better when all renovation is complete, until then I would stay away. Would suggest checking it out again then.

Reviews.Title: “Good quality room right beside Gare de Lyon”
Reviews.Author: awilson21
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is excellent, it is right beside Gare de Lyon and there is a small supermarket across the road. Rooms are tiny (even by Paris standards) but clean and with pretty decent decor. Pretty good buffet breakfast on offer.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, but more than adequate for the price”
Reviews.Author: park56
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Holiday Inn Bastille for six nights in late June 2009. Room was newly decorated and very efficient. While it was smaller than what we are used to in the U.S. , all the space is used wisely. Extremely clean. We were visiting during a heat wave (85-90 degrees each day), so the individually thermostatically-controlled air conditioning was a life-saver. Currently, the lobby is under construction. I expect when work is finished, that it will be quite nice. The bed was super comfortable and the staff was always polite. Given the fact the the metro station is less than a block away and the subway our primary means of transportation (only took one cab when we were out after the metro closed for the night), we were able to get wherever we needed to go easily. For the traveller who is looking for a budget-minded room, I would highly recommend. A breakfast buffet was available each morning on the first level, but we chose to eat in local cafes. Note: Sex shop on ground level next door is discreet. It should not hinder your decision to stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Room/Good Location/Spotty Service”
Reviews.Author: LOVENATLPARKS
Reviews.Content: This hotel has wonderful rooms. My wife, our twenty-year old son, and I stayed in a seventh floor suite for a week in early July 2009. The suite was less expensive than two rooms at this and practically any other Parisian three-star hotel. The beds were comfortable, the bathroom and toilet area were adequate, the television and refrigerator were fine, and the décor was very pleasing. The hotel’s proximity to the Gare de Lyon is its great selling point. We selected this hotel as we arrived from Italy around 11 pm and only had to cross the street to arrive at our hotel. Also, a Metro stop is less than 100 meters from the hotel-thus you can easily travel around Paris from this hotel’s location. Service and amenities at the hotel aren’t equal to the rooms. Breakfast at the hotel is over-priced at 16 euros per person, and internet access fees constitute outright usury. Use an internet café next door! Our room was cleaned daily, but the housekeeping staff frequently didn’t replace tissues, soap, and shampoo. Also, there is a coffee pot in the room, but some days we had to request replacement coffee. We received a packet of hot chocolate once, but that option never returned. Frequently, creamer and sugar were forgotten. The front desk staff was helpful in calling us a cab to travel to the airport, but my wife found their English vocabulary limited. I speak French so I had no problem in obtaining all of the assistance which I needed. Dinner was readily available in the neighborhood. There were fine brasseries up Rue de Lyon toward the Place de la Bastille as well as a fairly good couscous restaurant. Across from the Gare de Lyon (and heading south) on the Boulevard Diderot, one brasserie had particularly good food. For breakfast, two nearby patisseries were excellent and both sold canned orange and apple juices as well as croissants, baguettes, and pain au chocolat.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price”
Reviews.Author: anonymousPA
Reviews.Content: We got this hotel at the Friends and Family rate so it was a good value. We arrived by train at the Gare de Lyon which is about a block away. This was one of the few hotels we could find that had a room that would sleep three. Our room was very small by US standards (a king bed and a small twin murphy bed), but it was very modern and clean. We had a room facing the street but weren't bothered by the noise. I can't really rate the staff as we had no contact other then checking in. There were lots of nice restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, hotel pleasant.”
Reviews.Author: rkd29ny
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is a short walk to the Gare de Lyon train station which has access to multiple trains so it is easy to get where you want to go. There also were a number of restaurants and shops in the area. The hotel itself was partially under construction when we stayed so that took away from the "ambiance". I wouldn't say the hotel is anything spectacular but I didn't find anything to complain about. There was a lot to choose from at the breakfast. The room was small but very clean. We didn't interact much with the hotel staff but they were helpful and pleasant when we did. We shorted out a fuse the first hour we were there and the maintenance person came to fix it promptly.

Reviews.Title: “Dissappointed with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: lollipop237
Reviews.Content: Bounjour! We just came back from Paris and i have some little comments to this hotel specially the front desk. First, there's an asian lady who work in this hotel in the front desk who is NOT only friendly at all when i'm inquiring something about the local tour but also give you some face that is not acceptable, i want to confront this lady on the spot but my husband stop me to avoid some arguments early in the morning. Please we are a paying guest not staying for free for a week, pls review your staff. Second, as far as i know Hotel have to replenish some basic needs everyday, when i called from the room they said that the coffee and tea is for one time only and no replenish, to our surprised the third day they replenished everything after i leave tips on the table the night before, is this your hotel standard? i'm little bit confused, do we need to leave some tokens to have what we need? Melody and Kifi both black race did a good job and happy to help you in everything they can, salute to them.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best but OK”
Reviews.Author: KEITH TRAVEL AGENT
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 3 nights at the beginning of the month. I didn't know that there were major refurbishing works going on. We were upgraded to a nice executve room on the top floor, but it was tiny!!. The room was clean, and had a nice view, which was nice for the price paid, but pricey for an executive customer. The breakfast was taken in a dusty ad very cold breakfast room, as there are was plastic sheeting on the walls because of the refurbishing. My room wasn't done up the next day at 7 o'clock in the evening, and I was told that I should have left in the morning. After explaining that I was staying another night, I was told thet there were 2 Mr Palmers!! and that they had checked out the wrong room. I had to make the bed myself, which isn't bad for a hotel!! Ok, but not good enough.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, renovated rooms, good value”
Reviews.Author: NYtotheWorld
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised when I got upstairs to our room. l went to stay for 4 nights with my mom and I enjoyed our stay. If you are planning to stay anytime soon, just know that there is some construction going on in the hotel restaurant, so only breakfast was available. We never had the breakfast, so I can't comment on the restaurant at all. The location was great - about 1 block away from Gare de Lyon, a major station, and several restaurants, patisseries and a supermarket. The rooms looked very modern and must've been recently renovated. Very clean and modern, with a great little terrace and cool view. I got a really good internet only, prepaid rate that I booked about 1 month in advance. No major issues. The staff was decent...not overly friendly and didn't go out of their way, but nice enough. Oh yeah, it is right next door to a sex shop, but no issues there.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, Comfy, but a few problems”
Reviews.Author: lynbello
Reviews.Content: This hotel worked very well for my purpose. I went during spring break with some friends and stayed for a week. I got a two room suite, as I asked for and my check in was very quick, I didnt have to wait around. The rooms are clean and comfortable and up to date, though it did get annoying not having a shower curtain. While the concierge were nice, they were not very helpful. They spoke some english which was nice, but only one person really knew how to navigate paris and really help with direction. If you need to get up early though I dont suggest asking for a wake up call, just set your cell phone. Out of the seven mornings I needed a wake up call I actually got four and all were off by about 10 to 15 min, it was really annoying. The location however is prime, Its exactly a block from Gare Lyon, which is a major station for the Metro and RER, and lots of buses. Also your like a five minute walk from Gare Austilitz which has the train that takes you right to Versaille. There is a sex shop next door, but its not that bad, theres a huge sign, but theres nothing in the windows or doorway, its all blacked out.

Reviews.Title: “Next door to sex shop/adult cinema”
Reviews.Author: mrscg09
Reviews.Content: We booked this as a honeymoon weekend hotel. Having travelled to Paris in my wedding dress I was horrified to find this next door to a sex shop and an adult cinema. Nowhere did I find this mentioned on the internet or in any of their brochures! We booked a suite which was on the 7th floor and was a nice room. The hotel was generally very tired and in need of some serious renovations. I think they are going on but the reception was seriously in need of some attention. Stayed one night as we got there at midnight, thoroughly exhausted and to tired to do anything at that stage. Moved to a different H/I the very first thing the next morning. I am not sure this is a suitable destination for children.

Reviews.Title: “A good experience”
Reviews.Author: nigelshomes
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night in January on our way to the south of France. We used Holiday Inn Priority Club points and received just the greeting we had hoped for. Nothing to sign, nothing to pay, put straight into an executive level room, breakfast included, and checkout the next morning was just as good. Our corridor did not have the swirly carpet pattern shown in the travellers photo, and our bathroom had wrought iron art deco patterns on the glass. We had a nice view, including a view of the (tip of!) Eiffel Tower. Breakfast was comprehensive, tasty, and all there at the beginning of the time advertised (we had a very early train). It really is just over the road from the Gare de Lyon. A word of advise == get there early as the station, particularly underground, is really confusing. This is a really good hotel for a brief stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: onewickedb
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location (next to restaurants, mini marts and the train station). The room was also very comfortable and modernly decorated. Apparently this location used to be a palace of some sort. I loved the architecture and over-all look of this hotel. The staff was also very friendly and helpful. We arrived one day late as we missed our plane in New York and upon arrival, the airline had lost all of our luggage. We did not get any of our luggage back for the first two days of our trip. So the staff supplied us with a kit filled with toothpaste, a toothbrush, comb, etc. They also pointed us in the direction of the nearest stores so that we could buy some clothes. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Paris. Location, comfort, excellent service and a reasonable price...what more could you ask for??

Reviews.Title: “Very close to Gare de Lyon station”
Reviews.Author: bevjane
Reviews.Content: We visited Paris to take my son to Disney, and chose this hotel because it was very close to the Gare de Lyon station with trains directly to the Disney parks. This is great when you return from the parks late at night exhausted.The station is large and it is very easy to get lost. If you make your way up to the main line station and leave by the entrance at the foot of the wrought iron staircase to the restaurant, you will see the hotel immediately in front of you, about a two minute walk away. The hotel itself is very clean and elegantly decorated and furnished. The bedroom contained a bigger than average double bed, plus a single bed that folded away into the wall and also a plasma screen . The bathroom was clean with a bath and shower. The restaurant served a variety of breakfast items and the selection was perfectly adequate. It was a very pleasant place to eat. We booked in advance through Hotels.com and paid before we arrived. When we checked in we were expected, so our booking had obviously been passed on. On checking out, though, there was no record of us having paid. We had to pay a second time and try to claim a refund when we got home. Our money was refunded easily enough, but try to keep your payment receipt handy as proof of advance payment and you won't have to go to the bother that we did. Altogether a great hotel. Great location if it's Disney you are visiting. Elegant and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AggieTom94
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel for the price. It has been recently renovated and is very quiet and clean. The rooms are small but adequate. The first room they put us in had a window that wouldn't close and was very cold but they moved us without any trouble. The breakfast is okay, nothing spectacular but very adequate. The desk gave us two peices of information that were incorrect, they are very pleasant and believable but don't trust the information. Versailles is not open on Monday and not all Air France flights arrive at terminal one. The internet does not work, wi-fi or modem. There is an internet cafe next door but you have to pay. So don't expect to be able to use the internet at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Bed Makes Up For The Rest”
Reviews.Author: mklein818
Reviews.Content: Ok--this Holiday Inn is a bit pricey and lacks the coherent service offering that once made HI a roadside favorite. Indeed, the front desk and lobby seem shoehorned into a once-grand Parisian expanse. But for a guy coming off an eastbound transatlantic flight, the soft-firm queensize bed in my nicely renovated room was the lap of luxury. The bed was fantastic, the lightswitches easily reached from the bed, the flat screen of appropriate size, and the shower worked as one would expect from a HI anywhere. It was exactly what I needed...

Reviews.Title: “Won't be staying here again”
Reviews.Author: LondonWes
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel many times before for business trips. The rooms are comfortable and spacious but the customer service is almost non existent. I stayed for 3 nights and requested an iron be delivered to my room every day but never received it, despite them promising to send one up straight away. I also requested wake up calls every morning and only once got the call. I decided to have an early night one day, and ordered room service. The menu was terrible and the food seemed microwaved- the pasta was burnt and the chicken very dry and bland. My complaints might seem petty, but when staying in a hotel on business the above problems were quite significant to me. I will be looking to stay somewhere else when I am back in Paris in early 2009.

Reviews.Title: “Love it”
Reviews.Author: veraduffy53
Reviews.Content: Most fabulous hotel, wonderful decor and empecable service. ash trays provided for a smoke on the terrace,and an easy location to find food,shopping and sight seeing. I`m going back there this September

Reviews.Title: “Nice Accomadations, close to subway & train. Good Breakfest. B+”
Reviews.Author: masonite10
Reviews.Content: We came in on Bastille day and it took a little bumping around to find the hotel. (Best way is too take the Subway from the Airport to Gare de Lyon station). We came in and spoke with the front attendants, both were very nice and spoke english. They arranged to have us in are room early. We were suprised at how nice the rooms were for a two star hotel. The next morning they had a breakfest buffet with breakfest food that can compared to that of the States, England, Ireland and France. The breakfest was very nice. I would consider coming back and staying at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Fine when you find it”
Reviews.Author: wingate
Reviews.Content: I was booked into this hotel as a member of a group.I was able to go straight up to the room.I found it to be comfortable,of a reasonable size,i was on my own in a twin bed room,clean and with reasonable amenities.The bed was reasonably soft although i found the pillow a bit hard.There is no bedside table but a sort of sideboard behind the bed.The bathroom was of a decent size. Breakfast was more than adequate and i have to say that i have no complaints about the hotel itself.However i would not stay there again for one big reason,location.It is not very central,you have to go 3 stops on the RER from CDG Etoile.It is like being in a cattel truck.The 10 minute journey leaves you wringing wet from the heat in the carriages.When you get to the entrance hall of the metro at Gare D Lyon you may as well be in Hampton Court maize.You need to look for sortie 6.Alaas it disappears for a time,so yo have to be persistent.You need to go up into themainline station and head for the main entrance.Come straight out and looking at you dead ahead is the hotel.Virtually all of my group managed to get lost on the first night at the hotel.I came out at sortie 13 and it was unlucky for me as it took me 45 minutes to find the hotel!I always prefer a centrally located hotel,so although my stay was pleasant it is unlikely that i would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location for a Holiday Inn”
Reviews.Author: WozandStu
Reviews.Content: So,off I go for a 2 night stay at the Holiday Inn Paris Bastille. Arrived at the tired looking reception about 10pm on a Sunday night to find check-in a breeze and was given my room key. Once I get to my room I find that there is already someone in this room and returning to reception I discover that they have no record of anyone staying in that room but give me another room without any hassle. The room was tastefully decorated and was towards the back which meant that I would not be disturbed by the traffic. The room was clean and the wall mounted flat screen television was a nice surprise. The public areas of the hotel look a little dated and could do with some renovation. I did not have breakfast at the hotel so cannot comment. Although, the strange thing was, when I went to checkout they had charged me for 2 breakfasts when my room rate was room only, as confirmed with my Business Travel voucher. The hotel is ideally situated in a nice part of Paris and only a couple of minutes walk from Gard de Lyon station which has direct links to the main tourist areas of Paris and Disneyland Paris.

Reviews.Title: “paris c'est magnifique”
Reviews.Author: sajag78
Reviews.Content: Booked through Holiday Inn's own website and I was happy with the rate we got. I was a bit apprehensive after reading some of the online reviews, but the room was very modern and clean and although the room wasn't the biggest, we had the king size bed we'd booked (which was very comfortable) and a good sized bathroom. Only had a couple of minor grumbles: - very little storage space - half a wardrobe so we had to use our suitcases, which wasn't a prob for 4 nights but might have annoyed me more for longer - they took up the carpet in the hallway of our floor on the 2nd day with no warning - not a bit deal and it was being replaced the day we left but would've been nice to have been told. - my boyfriend ordered room service late on our last night - lasagne and it was lukewarm and clearly a 'ding' meal put in a ceramic dish with no bread or fries or anything. However, when we were checking out the guy asked us how it was and when we said it wasn't great he said we didn't have to pay for it or for the drinks we'd had from the minibar, so that was totally fine! The hotel is in a good location - we walked just about everywhere but it's literally a block from the Gare de Lyon, so it was dead easy to get to and from Charles de Gaulle and there is also a train direct from there to Disneyland Paris which only takes about 25mins and runs very frequently right up until about 11pm - we were there for the park opening and then they practically had to throw us out at night! One other thing is that there is a sex shop right on the corner beside the hotel, but there's no offensive window dressings or anything, so it didn't bother us, although might prompt questions from children of a certain age! Other than that we found the surrounding area fine - there's a great wee patisserie and we had dinner one night at one of the brasseries right across from the station and it was magic. All in, after reading some of the reviews of other independent hotels in paris I think we made a good choice - if you spend any length of time in a hotel room in paris there's something far wrong, so all you're really looking for is a clean, modern, comfortable room in a good location and this definitely met the criteria.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice very modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: travfamChicago
Reviews.Content: Very nice business oriented hotel. We had two rooms here in April 2008. We were on the 6th floor. Front desk staff spoke english very well. One of two rooms was available and we were checked in very early. Although it was not a big concern for us, staff ensured we had two adjoining rooms. Very modern rooms. Dual entry doors. Flat TV on wall, etched glass bathroom entry door. All lighting controlled from entry way or above bed. Room had mini bar / fridge and electronic safe. Bedding was very comfortable (king size bed in Paris!). Easy one block walk from Gare de Lyon. There are a few upscale seafood restaurants toward Gare de Lyon as well as a bunch of other dining choices. Grocery store and bakery across street from hotel. Hotel web site lists on-site guest self laundry, but this is not true. Self laundramat is located within one block up Rue Traversiere. Wireless internet access is 8EUR for 1 hour within a 24 hour period. As mentioned in other reviews, there are a few Sex toy / video stores next to hotel. We did arrive back late frequently and never felt unsafe walking back from Gare de Lyon. Enjoy a crepe made on order until 11:30 pm at a little stand just a few steps from the hotel entrance.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel management screws the casual traveler”
Reviews.Author: udubCS
Reviews.Content: Booked a room with king sized bed yet given room with two double beds. When complained, told no other rooms available which was "crud" because other business folks were checking in the next day. I complained even to Travelocity which was impotent on correcting the problem...where was the gnome. Travelocity said here's a voucher for next stay booked with them. Room was quaint and bathroom in great shape.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Short Trips and Seeing the City!”
Reviews.Author: akoneill826
Reviews.Content: From San Francisco, CA We stayed here the first week of September and had no problems. We were on the 6th floor facing the street which gave us a nice view of the area but we preferred going out and exploring to sitting in the room staring out the window. We were greeted warmly by a man at the front desk upon check in who gave us a map when I asked if they had one, which was very helpful for finding the sites and navigating the metro. We also had no problems with our reservations and were never told we had to pay a different rate than what I reserved it at on the Holiday Inn's website, which I was worried about when reading other reviews. It is about 4 miles from the Eiffel Tower which can be far for people who dont like to walk but it is a great way to see all of the city. The hotel is only about a mile from Notre Dame and its a very pretty walk along the Seine to it. The sex shop next door is very noticeable (giant neon lights are hard to miss) but its not obnoxious in anyway and unless you want to go in, it is not a wont bother you (Which if you do want to go in I guess you wont be bothered either!). The breakfast was ok, the eggs I didnt eat and the bacon looked raw but they had fresh croissants (even chocolate ones), cereal, sausages, fruit, milk, juice, coffee, toast and other breakfast items to have instead, and if it comes with your room you cant go wrong. The room was small but perfect for the 2 days we were there, besides who comes to Paris to stay in their room? We didnt turn on the TV once, although it was a nice flat screen TV hanging on the wall. I found no problems with the shower head whatsoever and actually thought the water pressure was quite good compared to some European places I have been! The metro station is right across the street and there are several nice little cafes around the area. The Bastille area is not the most happening area in Paris but it was only a 10 euro taxi ride to the Eiffel Tower and even less to other areas that are more fun to be around. We paid 119 euro a night, with breakfast included, which by Paris standards is excellent... All in all, if you want a decent priced hotel that is easy to get to and from, close to nice areas and safe, this is a good place to stay. I would stay here again if I could get the same rate the next time. Hopefully this helps!

Reviews.Title: “Not the best Holiday Inn”
Reviews.Author: Gags
Reviews.Content: Yes, unfortunately, not the best Holiday Inn. When we checked in, we were greeted with a surly receptionist, who did not seem bothered we were there. She could not even see my name on my reservation sheet and I had to produce my passport. I did ask for a top floor room and duly got one, but wished I had’nt bothered, as these rooms are more like attic rooms with the roof sloping down along the entire length and absolutely stinking of smoke; although this entire floor is supposed to be smoke free and they have smoke alarms in the rooms??. Also it was not a kingsize bed, just a 4’ 6” double. When I asked about the safe key, the same receptionist informed me that the previous guest had not returned it! I was offered no other option. I was going to ask about changing the room, but thought it best until a more amenable receptionist was on duty. As in other reviews, yes you can see the top of the Eiffel tower from the 7th floor, but only the top and if it is hazy, then you wont see it at all! The second room we were assigned was much better with a proper sized room and kingsize bed. Of course this was my personal experience and others may not have any trouble at all, it is still annoying as I am a platinum card holder and usually receive a much better standard of service and recognition. Overall the hotel is very well used, with smoking going on in all public areas. It could do with an update, but they say on the website it has been recently upgraded? Also they may boast of sound proof rooms, but you can just hear the lift machinery if you have a room just outside the lifts. The lifts can be slow if it is busy. There are no English language programs on the in room TV, outside of pay per view – about 5 French channels and a German one! Not even CNN or BBC World! Breakfast is good, but not much difference to a Holiday Inn express – I was expecting a full cooked option, although they do have scrambled eggs and sausages on offer along with cereals, croissants and other pastries. Location is good – 5 mins from the Gare de Lyon – although once inside the station it can be a further 5 min walk to find the correct subway or RER LINE! There is a good bar just outside the hotel which serves fine Belgian brews, and cheap for Paris at around 3 Euros.

Reviews.Title: “Great quality , great chic !”
Reviews.Author: Flyingdutchboy
Reviews.Content: For the price I paid, this is an excellent hotel ! Great location, beautifully stylish ( chic french grandeur ) ! We stayed here for the 2nd time and now we had a really beautiful room on the street-side, with a great balcony and lots of glass, so that the sun waked us up in the morning ! Very fine decoration , nice bathroom ( here just one problem : the douche-head doesn't work the way it has to ) ; beds are good. Friendly staff. Very good and abundant breakfast in a very stylish ( again ! ) hall on the ground-floor. Two elevators. We had a great time and we'll be back here !

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough”
Reviews.Author: MerryCanberra
Reviews.Content: This was our first stop in Europe and while the room was nice enough, big (ish) for European standards, the bar fridge didn't work and was leaking water in the wardrobe and when we reported it they replaced it with another one, which also didn't work. The staff were nice and service was prompt. I would recommend staying here if on a budget but i am sure the other holiday inn nearby would be nicer. The lift was tiny and slow and the hotel was a bit old. Overall however it was fine, clean and air conditioned.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent base”
Reviews.Author: DevonianBusinessman
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I enjoyed an overnight stay at the Holiday Inn Bastille which is only about 150m from the Gare du Lyon railway Station in Paris. The staff were very welcoming and pleasant and the room spacious and clean. We were able to walk from here to Notre Dame in about 20 minutes and the nearest Metro station is about 5 minutes away so the location is an ideal base from which to see Paris. The hotel is a 3 star by UK standards and is reasonably priced compared to many other hotels. Some reviews mentioned the sex shop next door but if you're not interested in visiting this establishment it won't affect you in the slightest. Overall a good hotel with no real frills but a place I'd go back to.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, handy location”
Reviews.Author: imcdonald5
Reviews.Content: Booked a family room but was given a double on arrival. But this was fixed quickly by friendly reception staff. (Watch out as the family rooms have a folding bed that looks like a wardrobe! I COMPLAINED A SECOND TIME BY MISTAKE!!) Really easy to find if you take the bus from Charles de Gaulle. Get off at Gare de Lyon, cross the road and Rue de Lyon is just to the left. 150m along the road and you're there. Breakfast is really quite expensive - especially when, like us, you don't take it but are charged for it on departure! CHECK YOUR BILL! One of the best bakeries you'll ever find is across the road and they make croissants to die for. That takes care of breakfast! and along the Rue de Lyon is a Tea/Coffee shop you can get take aways from. Overall, good value for Paris, handy for the metro and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place!”
Reviews.Author: Chopper79
Reviews.Content: Interesting old building, bit shabby downstairs but rooms v.nicely renovated. It's not particularly central - no views of the Eiffel Tower here I'm afraid! But, good local area, with plenty of cafes for hot chocolate etc. There is a sex shop next door, but don't be put off!!! You can use the Metro v.easily from here and the Air France Bus (which departs from CDG Terminal 2) will drop you off v.close. Just get on board at the airport and ask for Gare de Lyon.

Reviews.Title: “Great Parisian hotel”
Reviews.Author: Veera
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great surprise! Probably the best hotel in this class that I have ever stayed in in Paris. The rooms were clean, the service was good and even breakfast was quite nice. The location is very convenient, too. The sex shop really is next door, but is in my opinion pretty discreet, so it didn't bother at all. I can warmly recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to avoid spending too much for a 5-star hotel !

Reviews.Title: “More than I expected”
Reviews.Author: scark
Reviews.Content: I had heard stories about the small hotel rooms in Paris, but this hotel pleasantly surprised us. The room accomodated the king bed with room to spare! Bath was a little small, but acceptable. No breakfast was included and the room service and buffet were both 15 Euros. We stayed 5 nights in October and had a very good experience. We had booked a flight/hotel package deal and when we checked in there was some confusion on if the room was already paid for. The staff to their credit were very helpful in checking on and resolving this. They spoke very good English and were very polite. The location was great! We took the Air France shuttle from CDG and its stop at the Gare De Lyon was only one block from the hotel. Also, the metro was very near also. Be sure to check out the Patiserrie located out the door to the left and about one block down. Excellent food and very reasonable. The only bad thing about this hotel is the sex shop right next door.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Holiday Inn, Bastille”
Reviews.Author: Maryseattle
Reviews.Content: What a find! We stayed at the Holiday Inn 3 night is September. It was a beautiful stay. The room was beautiful and large for European standards. Hotel is very well situated for seeing Paris. The hop-on-hop off bus (a great way to see Paris) is right in front. We walked from Gare de Lyon station and the Air France bus to the airport. Also, easy walk to Notre Dame and Marais district. But the best part, was the breakfast. Excellent. If it is included in the price, it is an excellent deal. We will definately stay here again on our next trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: Caroline2kelly
Reviews.Content: The hotel reception staff were very friendly and helpful and even though we arrived early they were still able to check us in and give us a lovely room with a balcony. The hotel was clean and comfortable in a nice area of Paris and well worth the 119 euro per night. The hotel is a 2 min walk from the Gare de Lyon train station were you can get trains to all over France and Italy it also has the RER line A that takes you directly to Eurodisney and metro line 1 that gets you all over Paris. The metro is also cheap and easy to use.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff at the Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Trésor
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel after reading the reviews on the convenient location, within walking distance from Gare de Lyon and the stop for Air France coach to Aeroport CDG. Enjoyed my 3 nites stay. The staff at reception - Felix, Céline & Mustapha were friendly and very helpful. Was given a room with double bed, not very spacious. Good enough for just 1 person since I am on my own. Nice bathroom. Breakfast was alright. Paid 97.50 euros per nite for room including breakfast. Wouldn't mind to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good value”
Reviews.Author: Delreybird
Reviews.Content: This may be a Holiday Inn, but it's still a Parisian hotel in the 19th Century "Empire" style. We selected it because it's just a short walk from the Gare de Lyon, where we would later be boarding a train to link up with a river cruise. It also happens to be within reasonably easy walking distance of Notre Dame and all the major attractions of both the right and left banks -- about four miles from the Musee D'Orsay on the left bank and about an equal distance from the Place de la Concorde on the right bank. Since we love to walk, the location was ideal for us. We were very happy with our stay here. The room, while somewhat small, was very comfortable and tastefully -- albeit somewhat whackily -- decorated. The bathroom left a little to be desired. There was a doorstop in front of the toilet and we kept tripping on it. Try as we might, we couldn't avoid irrigating the bathroom floor while showering. But that's about the only fault we could find with the place. Frequented primarily by business travelers, the hotel was very quiet. The hot and cold buffet breakfast included with our room was excellent. All the staff were very nice. Plus, we got a very good deal here. I booked the room through Holiday Inn's Web site at 97.50 euros a night. At the exchange rate prevailing at checkout, that worked out to about $125 per night. I noticed that their rack rate for this room was actually 159 euros -- $203 per night. We'd stay here again, especially if the Gare de Lyon figured in a future trip.
